title: Lubalin Graph - Ligatures/alternates
content:
I am trying to buy a digital version of Lubalin Graph with all the Ligatures/alternates, as seen in this image from an old Letraset catalogue. I know Elsner+Flake have drawn an alternate version of Avant Garde, but they don't seem to have got round to LG yet.  
Can anyone help?

 ![](http://web.archive.org/web/20100131123835im_/http:/typophile.com/files/DSCF3336_6174.JPG)
author: belleisle

comments.content: yeah these have not been digitized. havent heard any plans of them to be done... i have utilized them by redrawing them myself.

Lubalin put the ligatures in as an aid to his own predilection for doing tightly spaced, fully justified headlines. The ligatures were a design solution to the problem of making two or more lines of type come out to the same length without changing spacing, size or proportions.
